snippet: The mother of Jason Rezaian, The Washington Post’s Tehran correspondent, who has been incarcerated without publicly explained charges since July 22, said Friday that she feared new delays in his trial.
abstract: Mary Rezaian, mother of Washington Post correspondent Jason Rezaian, who has been imprisoned in Iran since July 2014, says Iranian authorities have curbed prison visits from his Iranian wife and fears his trial will not begin until April.
lead_paragraph: The mother of Jason Rezaian, The Washington Post’s Tehran correspondent, who has been incarcerated without publicly explained charges since July 22, said Friday that she feared new delays in his trial.

headline.main: Iran: Delays Feared in Reporter’s Trial
headline.print_headline: Iran: Delays Feared in Reporter’s Trial
